intro: Leptunis, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, including Leptunis ciliata and Leptunis tenuifolia. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. They typically grow in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Leptunis species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
